post.author: 김태희
post.content:
Job Number: 4878805

Title: Web developer (Junior Web Developer) (NOC: 2175)

Terms of Employment: Temporary, Part Time, Day

Salary: $17.00 Hourly for 30 hours per week

Anticipated Start Date: As soon as possible

Location: Toronto, Ontario (1 vacancy)

Skill Requirements:

Education: Completion of university

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.): Not required

Experience: 2 years to less than 3 years

Languages: Speak English, Read English, Write English

Work Setting: Government

Specific Skills: Prepare mock-ups and storyboards, Source, select and organize information for inclusion and design the appearance, layout and flow of the web site, Create and optimize content for web site using a variety of graphics, database, animation and other software

Programming Languages: ASP, HTML, DHTML, Java, Java Script, CSS, PHP

Computer and Technology Knowledge: Windows, Programming software, HTML editing software, Web site creation and management software, Web service design, Programming languages

Applications: Adobe Acrobat Reader, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Flash

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: Fast-paced environment, Work under pressure, Tight deadlines, Attention to detail, Sitting

Essential Skills: Reading text, Writing, Working with others, Problem solving, Critical thinking, Job task planning and organizing, Significant use of memory, Computer use

Other Information:For full job description, go to www.workink.com - Job Posting page.

Employer: The Canadian Council on Rehabilitation and Work

How to Apply:

Please apply for this job only in the manner specified by the employer. Failure to do so may result in your application not being properly considered for the position.

By E-mail: info@ccrw.org
Online: http://www.ccrw.org
Business Profile: Providing employment opportunities to persons with disabilities..

Web Site: http://www.ccrw.org

Advertised until: 2010/03/08

This job advertisement has been provided by an external employer. Service Canada is not responsible for the accuracy, authenticity or reliability of the content.
post.title: Web developer (Junior Web Developer) (NOC: 2175)
